question: The min and max attributes specify ____ values for number inputs.
explanation: min and max define allowed minimum and maximum values.

question: The step attribute specifies legal number ____ for inputs.
explanation: step defines the increment between valid values.

question: The multiple attribute allows ____ selections in a <select>.
explanation: multiple lets users choose more than one option.

question: The selected attribute makes an option ____ by default.
explanation: selected pre-selects an option in a drop-down list.

question: The rows attribute specifies the visible number of ____ in a textarea.
explanation: rows defines how many lines of text are visible.

question: The cols attribute specifies the visible ____ of a textarea.
explanation: cols defines how many characters wide the textarea appears.

question: The wrap attribute specifies how text ____ in a textarea.
explanation: wrap controls whether text wraps to the next line.

question: The action attribute specifies where to send form ____.
explanation: action contains the URL that processes the form submission.

question: The method attribute specifies the HTTP ____ for form submission.
explanation: method defines how form data is sent (GET or POST).

question: The enctype attribute specifies how form data should be ____.
explanation: enctype sets the encoding type for form data.

question: The target attribute specifies where to open a ____.
explanation: target defines where linked documents open (same tab, new tab, etc.).

question: The charset attribute specifies the character ____ for the document.
explanation: charset defines the character encoding (like UTF-8).

question: The lang attribute specifies the ____ of the content.
explanation: lang indicates the language of the element's content.

question: The title attribute provides additional ____ about an element.
explanation: title shows extra information when hovering over an element.

question: The id attribute specifies a ____ identifier for an element.
explanation: id gives an element a unique name within the page.

question: The class attribute specifies one or more ____ names for styling.
explanation: class assigns CSS classes to elements for styling.

question: The style attribute specifies inline CSS ____.
explanation: style applies CSS rules directly to an element.

question: The tabindex attribute specifies the tab ____ of an element.
explanation: tabindex controls the order when tabbing through elements.

question: The contenteditable attribute makes element content ____.
explanation: contenteditable allows users to edit content directly.

question: The hidden attribute ____ an element from view.
explanation: hidden removes an element from display (but not from DOM).

question: The draggable attribute makes an element ____.
explanation: draggable enables drag-and-drop functionality.

question: The spellcheck attribute enables ____ checking for text.
explanation: spellcheck highlights misspelled words in editable content.

question: The dir attribute specifies text ____ (ltr or rtl).
explanation: dir controls text direction: left-to-right or right-to-left.

question: The <strong> element indicates ____ importance.
explanation: <strong> shows that text has strong importance.

question: The <em> element indicates ____ emphasis.
explanation: <em> emphasizes text, typically displayed in italics.

question: The <b> element makes text ____ without extra importance.
explanation: <b> makes text bold for stylistic purposes.

question: The <i> element makes text ____ for various purposes.
explanation: <i> italicizes text for technical terms, thoughts, etc.

question: The <u> element ____ text for stylistic purposes.
explanation: <u> underlines text (though CSS is preferred).

question: The <mark> element ____ text for reference.
explanation: <mark> highlights text like a marker pen.

question: The <small> element defines ____ text.
explanation: <small> renders text in a smaller size.

question: The <sub> element defines ____ text.
explanation: <sub> makes text appear half a character below normal.

question: The <sup> element defines ____ text.
explanation: <sup> makes text appear half a character above normal.

question: The <del> element defines ____ text.
explanation: <del> shows text that has been removed.

question: The <ins> element defines ____ text.
explanation: <ins> shows text that has been added.

question: The <code> element defines computer ____.
explanation: <code> displays programming code snippets.

question: The <pre> element defines ____ text.
explanation: <pre> preserves spaces and line breaks exactly as written.

question: The <kbd> element defines keyboard ____.
explanation: <kbd> represents user keyboard input.

question: The <samp> element defines sample ____ from a program.
explanation: <samp> shows sample output from a computer program.

question: The <var> element defines a programming ____.
explanation: <var> represents variables in code or math.

question: The <abbr> element defines an ____ or acronym.
explanation: <abbr> marks up abbreviations with optional title attribute.

question: The <cite> element defines the ____ of a work.
explanation: <cite> marks up titles of books, movies, etc.

question: The <blockquote> element defines a long ____.
explanation: <blockquote> marks up extended quotes from other sources.

question: The <q> element defines a short ____ quotation.
explanation: <q> marks up short inline quotations.

question: The <dfn> element defines a ____ term.
explanation: <dfn> marks the defining instance of a term.

question: The <address> element defines ____ information.
explanation: <address> provides contact information for the author.

question: The <time> element defines a specific ____ or datetime.
explanation: <time> marks up times and dates in machine-readable format.

question: The <progress> element shows the ____ of a task.
explanation: <progress> displays a progress bar for completing tasks.

question: The <meter> element shows a ____ measurement within a range.
explanation: <meter> displays measurements like disk usage or ratings.

question: The <output> element shows the ____ of a calculation.
explanation: <output> displays the result of script calculations.

question: The <details> element creates an expandable ____ widget.
explanation: <details> creates show/hide content sections.

question: The <summary> element provides a ____ for <details>.
explanation: <summary> gives a clickable heading for details sections.

question: The <dialog> element creates a dialog ____ or window.
explanation: <dialog> creates modal or non-modal dialog boxes.

question: The <template> element holds client-side ____ content.
explanation: <template> contains HTML that can be cloned and inserted later.

question: The <slot> element defines a ____ in a web component.
explanation: <slot> creates insertion points in custom elements.

question: The <canvas> element provides a drawing ____ for JavaScript.
explanation: <canvas> creates a pixel-based drawing area for graphics.

question: The <svg> element defines ____ vector graphics.
explanation: <svg> creates resolution-independent vector graphics.

question: The <audio> element embeds ____ content.
explanation: <audio> plays audio files like music or podcasts.

question: The <video> element embeds ____ content.
explanation: <video> plays video files or streams.

question: The <source> element specifies media ____ for <audio> or <video>.
explanation: <source> provides alternative media files for different situations.

question: The <track> element specifies text ____ for media.
explanation: <track> adds subtitles, captions, or descriptions to media.

question: The <picture> element provides ____ images.
explanation: <picture> serves different images based on screen size or resolution.

question: The <figure> element defines ____ content like images.
explanation: <figure> marks up illustrations, diagrams, photos, etc.

question: The <figcaption> element defines a ____ for <figure>.
explanation: <figcaption> provides a caption or legend for a figure.

question: The <main> element defines the ____ content area.
explanation: <main> contains the central, unique content of the page.

question: The <nav> element defines a ____ section.
explanation: <nav> contains navigation links like menus.

question: The <header> element defines introductory ____.
explanation: <header> typically contains logos, headings, and navigation.

question: The <footer> element defines a ____ for a document or section.
explanation: <footer> contains information like copyright, contact, etc.

question: The <article> element defines ____, self-contained content.
explanation: <article> represents content that could stand alone.

question: The <section> element defines a ____ in a document.
explanation: <section> groups thematically related content.

question: The <aside> element defines content ____ from the main content.
explanation: <aside> contains related but tangential content like sidebars.

question: The <dl> element defines a ____ list.
explanation: <dl> creates lists of terms and their definitions.

question: The <dt> element defines a ____ in a description list.
explanation: <dt> marks the term being defined.

question: The <dd> element defines a ____ in a description list.
explanation: <dd> provides the definition or description of a term.

question: The <colgroup> element groups table ____ for formatting.
explanation: <colgroup> allows styling of entire columns at once.

question: The <col> element specifies ____ for table columns.
explanation: <col> defines properties for one or more columns.

question: The <thead> element groups table ____ content.
explanation: <thead> contains header rows in a table.

question: The <tbody> element groups table ____ content.
explanation: <tbody> contains the main data rows of a table.

question: The <tfoot> element groups table ____ content.
explanation: <tfoot> contains summary or footer rows in a table.

question: The colspan attribute specifies how many ____ a cell should span.
explanation: colspan makes a cell extend across multiple columns.

question: The rowspan attribute specifies how many ____ a cell should span.
explanation: rowspan makes a cell extend across multiple rows.

question: The headers attribute references ____ cells for a data cell.
explanation: headers links data cells to their corresponding header cells.

question: The scope attribute specifies whether a header cell is for a column, row, or ____.
explanation: scope defines the scope of header cells for accessibility.

question: The <map> element defines a client-side image ____.
explanation: <map> creates clickable areas on an image.

question: The <area> element defines a ____ area within an image map.
explanation: <area> defines one hot spot in an image map.

question: The shape attribute defines the ____ of an area in an image map.
explanation: shape specifies whether area is rectangle, circle, or polygon.

question: The coords attribute defines ____ for an area in an image map.
explanation: coords specifies the pixel coordinates of clickable areas.

question: The <iframe> element embeds another HTML ____.
explanation: <iframe> displays another webpage within the current page.

question: The sandbox attribute restricts ____ content in an iframe.
explanation: sandbox adds security restrictions to iframe content.

question: The srcdoc attribute specifies ____ HTML for an iframe.
explanation: srcdoc allows writing HTML directly in the attribute.

question: The loading attribute controls ____ loading of images and iframes.
explanation: loading='lazy' defers loading until element is near viewport.

question: The decoding attribute controls how the browser ____ images.
explanation: decoding hints whether to decode images async or sync.

question: The fetchpriority attribute hints at resource fetch ____.
explanation: fetchpriority suggests high or low priority for loading.

question: The sizes attribute specifies image ____ for different layouts.
explanation: sizes tells browser what image size to use based on viewport.

question: The srcset attribute provides multiple image ____ for different situations.
explanation: srcset gives the browser choices of images for different resolutions.

question: The poster attribute specifies an image to show while video is ____.
explanation: poster displays a placeholder image before video plays.

question: The controls attribute shows media player ____.
explanation: controls displays play, pause, volume, and other controls.

question: The loop attribute makes media play ____.
explanation: loop causes media to restart when it finishes.

question: The muted attribute ____ audio output.
explanation: muted silences the audio track of media elements.

question: The playsinline attribute enables ____ playback on mobile devices.
explanation: playsinline prevents fullscreen playback on iOS.

question: The kind attribute specifies the ____ of text track.
explanation: kind can be subtitles, captions, descriptions, etc.

question: The srclang attribute specifies the ____ of track text.
explanation: srclang indicates the language of subtitles or captions.

question: The default attribute makes a track ____ by default.
explanation: default automatically enables a text track.

question: The <object> element embeds external ____ like PDFs or Flash.
explanation: <object> can embed various types of external content.

question: The data attribute specifies the ____ of the object's data.
explanation: data provides the address of the object resource.

question: The <param> element defines ____ for an <object> element.
explanation: <param> passes parameters to embedded objects.

question: The <embed> element embeds external ____ or plugins.
explanation: <embed> is a generic container for external content.

question: The usemap attribute associates an image with an image ____.
explanation: usemap links an to a element.

question: The ismap attribute indicates a ____-side image map.
explanation: ismap passes click coordinates to server for processing.

question: The download attribute suggests ____ rather than navigation.
explanation: download tells browser to download the linked file.

question: The ping attribute tracks link ____ for analytics.
explanation: ping sends notification to URLs when link is clicked.

question: The hreflang attribute specifies the ____ of the linked document.
explanation: hreflang indicates the language of the target page.

question: The media attribute specifies ____/device capabilities.
explanation: media can target specific screen sizes, orientations, etc.

question: The async attribute loads scripts ____.
explanation: async lets scripts download without blocking page parsing.

question: The defer attribute delays script execution until page ____.
explanation: defer waits until HTML is fully parsed before executing.

question: The crossorigin attribute handles ____ requests.
explanation: crossorigin manages Cross-Origin Resource Sharing.

question: The integrity attribute verifies ____ integrity.
explanation: integrity checks that fetched resources haven't been tampered with.

question: The referrerpolicy attribute controls ____ information sent.
explanation: referrerpolicy decides what referrer information to include.

question: The <script> element embeds or references executable ____.
explanation: <script> contains or links to JavaScript code.

question: The <noscript> element provides content when ____ are disabled.
explanation: <noscript> shows alternative content if JavaScript is off.

question: The <style> element contains CSS ____ definitions.
explanation: <style> holds CSS rules for the document.

question: The scoped attribute limits styles to the parent ____ (deprecated).
explanation: scoped made CSS rules apply only within the parent element.

question: The <link> element links external ____ like stylesheets.
explanation: <link> connects to CSS files, icons, fonts, etc.

question: The rel attribute specifies the ____ between documents.
explanation: rel defines how the linked resource relates to current document.

question: The <meta> element provides ____ about the document.
explanation: <meta> gives information about character set, viewport, etc.

question: The name attribute in <meta> specifies metadata ____.
explanation: name identifies the type of metadata being provided.

question: The http-equiv attribute provides ____ header information.
explanation: http-equiv can simulate HTTP headers like refresh.

question: The viewport meta tag controls ____ on mobile devices.
explanation: viewport settings affect how pages display on mobile screens.

question: The <base> element specifies the base ____ for relative URLs.
explanation: <base> sets default URL and target for all relative links.

question: The accesskey attribute specifies a keyboard ____ for an element.
explanation: accesskey lets users activate elements with keyboard shortcuts.

question: The autocapitalize attribute controls text ____ in forms.
explanation: autocapitalize manages automatic capitalization on mobile.

question: The inputmode attribute provides hints for ____ keyboard configuration.
explanation: inputmode suggests what type of keyboard to show on mobile.

question: The is attribute specifies a ____ built-in element.
explanation: is makes standard elements behave like custom elements.

question: The itemscope attribute defines ____ for microdata.
explanation: itemscope creates a new microdata item.

question: The itemtype attribute specifies the ____ URL for microdata.
explanation: itemtype points to the schema.org or other vocabulary.

question: The itemprop attribute defines a ____ of an item.
explanation: itemprop marks an element as containing property data.

question: The data-* attributes store custom ____ private to the page.
explanation: data-* attributes let developers store extra information.

question: The role attribute defines the ____ of an element for accessibility.
explanation: role tells assistive tech what function an element serves.

question: The aria-label attribute provides an accessible ____ for an element.
explanation: aria-label gives elements a text label for screen readers.

question: The aria-labelledby attribute references elements that ____ the current element.
explanation: aria-labelledby points to elements that serve as labels.

question: The aria-describedby attribute references elements that ____ the current element.
explanation: aria-describedby points to elements that provide descriptions.

question: The aria-hidden attribute hides content from ____ APIs.
explanation: aria-hidden removes elements from accessibility tree.

question: The aria-live attribute indicates content ____ should be announced.
explanation: aria-live makes dynamic content updates announced to users.

question: The aria-atomic attribute indicates whether ____ region should be announced.
explanation: aria-atomic controls if entire region or just changes are announced.

question: The aria-busy attribute indicates an element is being ____.
explanation: aria-busy tells assistive tech that content is changing.

question: The aria-controls attribute identifies elements ____ by the current element.
explanation: aria-controls points to elements that this element controls.

question: The aria-current attribute indicates the ____ item within a set.
explanation: aria-current marks the current item in navigation, etc.

question: The aria-disabled attribute indicates an element is perceivable but ____.
explanation: aria-disabled communicates that an element exists but can't be used.

question: The aria-expanded attribute indicates ____ state of expandable elements.
explanation: aria-expanded tells whether content is expanded or collapsed.

question: The aria-haspopup attribute indicates an element has a ____.
explanation: aria-haspopup warns that activating an element opens a popup.

question: The aria-invalid attribute indicates entered value doesn't ____.
explanation: aria-invalid marks form fields with invalid input.

question: The aria-level attribute defines hierarchical ____ within a structure.
explanation: aria-level indicates heading level or treeitem depth.

question: The aria-modal attribute indicates whether an element is ____.
explanation: aria-modal tells if a dialog blocks interaction with other content.

question: The aria-multiline attribute indicates textbox accepts ____ lines.
explanation: aria-multiline specifies if a textbox is single or multi-line.

question: The aria-multiselectable attribute indicates multiple items can be ____.
explanation: aria-multiselectable marks lists where multiple selections are allowed.

question: The aria-orientation attribute indicates element ____ (horizontal/vertical).
explanation: aria-orientation tells if sliders, scrollbars, etc., are horizontal or vertical.

question: The aria-placeholder attribute defines ____ text.
explanation: aria-placeholder provides placeholder text for screen readers.

question: The aria-pressed attribute indicates ____ button state.
explanation: aria-pressed communicates whether a toggle button is pressed.

question: The aria-readonly attribute indicates element is not ____.
explanation: aria-readonly marks content that can be read but not changed.

question: The aria-required attribute indicates user input is ____.
explanation: aria-required marks form fields that must be filled out.

question: The aria-selected attribute indicates current ____ state.
explanation: aria-selected marks selected items in lists or grids.

question: The aria-sort attribute indicates ____ order of items.
explanation: aria-sort tells if a column is sorted ascending, descending, or other.

question: The aria-valuemax attribute defines maximum allowed ____.
explanation: aria-valuemax sets the upper bound for range widgets.

question: The aria-valuemin attribute defines minimum allowed ____.
explanation: aria-valuemin sets the lower bound for range widgets.

question: The aria-valuenow attribute defines current ____ of a range.
explanation: aria-valuenow indicates the current value of sliders, etc.

question: The aria-valuetext attribute defines human-readable ____ alternative.
explanation: aria-valuetext provides a text description of the current value.

question: The <ruby> element defines ____ annotations for East Asian typography.
explanation: <ruby> adds pronunciation guides above characters.

question: The <rt> element defines ____ text for ruby annotations.
explanation: <rt> provides the pronunciation text in ruby annotations.

question: The <rp> element provides ____ for browsers that don't support ruby.
explanation: <rp> shows parentheses around ruby text in non-supporting browsers.

question: The <bdi> element isolates ____ text formatting.
explanation: <bdi> isolates text that might have different directionality.

question: The <bdo> element overrides ____ text direction.
explanation: <bdo> forces text direction (ltr or rtl) regardless of context.

question: The <wbr> element suggests a word ____ opportunity.
explanation: <wbr> indicates where a word could be broken if needed.

question: The translate attribute specifies whether element content should be ____.
explanation: translate hints whether content should be translated by tools.

question: The <datalist> element provides ____ options for input fields.
explanation: <datalist> gives a list of suggested values for autocomplete.

question: The <optgroup> element groups related ____ in a drop-down list.
explanation: <optgroup> creates labeled groups of options in <select>.

question: The label attribute in <optgroup> provides a ____ for the group.
explanation: label gives a name to an option group in drop-down lists.

question: The form attribute associates an element with a specific ____.
explanation: form lets form controls be placed outside their parent <form>.

question: The formaction attribute overrides the form's ____ attribute.
explanation: formaction specifies a different submission URL for a button/input.

question: The formenctype attribute overrides the form's ____ attribute.
explanation: formenctype specifies different encoding for a specific submit button.

question: The formmethod attribute overrides the form's ____ attribute.
explanation: formmethod uses a different HTTP method for a specific submit button.

question: The formnovalidate attribute prevents ____ for a specific submit button.
explanation: formnovalidate skips validation when that button submits the form.

question: The formtarget attribute overrides the form's ____ attribute.
explanation: formtarget opens the response in a different window/frame.

question: The list attribute references a <datalist> element for ____.
explanation: list connects an input to a datalist for suggested values.

question: The accept attribute specifies accepted ____ types for file inputs.
explanation: accept restricts which file types users can select.

question: The capture attribute specifies media ____ source for file inputs.
explanation: capture tells mobile devices to use camera or microphone.

question: The dirname attribute creates a field for text ____ submission.
explanation: dirname sends text direction (ltr/rtl) along with form data.

question: The minlength attribute specifies minimum number of ____ required.
explanation: minlength ensures input has at least a certain number of characters.

question: The novalidate attribute prevents form ____ on submission.
explanation: novalidate turns off browser validation for the entire form.

question: The accept-charset attribute specifies accepted character ____ for form submission.
explanation: accept-charset tells server which character encodings are acceptable.

question: The onsubmit attribute specifies a script to run when form is ____.
explanation: onsubmit runs JavaScript when the form is submitted.

question: The onreset attribute specifies a script to run when form is ____.
explanation: onreset runs JavaScript when the form is reset.

question: The onchange attribute specifies a script to run when element ____ changes.
explanation: onchange triggers when an element's value is changed and loses focus.

question: The oninput attribute specifies a script to run when element gets user ____.
explanation: oninput triggers immediately when user types or changes value.

question: The oninvalid attribute specifies a script to run when element is ____.
explanation: oninvalid runs when an element fails validation.

question: The onsearch attribute specifies a script to run when user uses ____ input.
explanation: onsearch triggers when user presses enter in a search field.

question: The onselect attribute specifies a script to run when text is ____.
explanation: onselect triggers when user selects text in an input or textarea.

question: The onblur attribute specifies a script to run when element loses ____.
explanation: onblur triggers when an element loses keyboard focus.

question: The onfocus attribute specifies a script to run when element gets ____.
explanation: onfocus triggers when an element receives keyboard focus.

question: The onload attribute specifies a script to run when element is ____.
explanation: onload triggers when an element (like an image) finishes loading.

question: The onunload attribute specifies a script to run when document is ____.
explanation: onunload triggers when the user navigates away from the page.

question: The onbeforeunload attribute specifies a script to run ____ document is unloaded.
explanation: onbeforeunload triggers just before the page is unloaded.

question: The onerror attribute specifies a script to run when an ____ occurs.
explanation: onerror triggers when an error occurs loading an element.

question: The onresize attribute specifies a script to run when window is ____.
explanation: onresize triggers when the browser window is resized.

question: The onscroll attribute specifies a script to run when element is ____.
explanation: onscroll triggers when user scrolls within an element.

question: The onwheel attribute specifies a script to run when mouse ____ is rotated.
explanation: onwheel triggers when mouse wheel is rotated over element.

question: The oncopy attribute specifies a script to run when user ____ content.
explanation: oncopy triggers when user copies content from element.

question: The oncut attribute specifies a script to run when user ____ content.
explanation: oncut triggers when user cuts content from element.

question: The onpaste attribute specifies a script to run when user ____ content.
explanation: onpaste triggers when user pastes content into element.

question: The onabort attribute specifies a script to run when media loading is ____.
explanation: onabort triggers when media loading is stopped (e.g., user cancels).

question: The oncanplay attribute specifies a script to run when media can start ____.
explanation: oncanplay triggers when enough media has loaded to begin playback.

question: The oncanplaythrough attribute specifies a script to run when media can play to ____.
explanation: oncanplaythrough triggers when media can play through without buffering.

question: The oncuechange attribute specifies a script to run when text track ____ changes.
explanation: oncuechange triggers when the active cue in a text track changes.

question: The ondurationchange attribute specifies a script to run when media ____ changes.
explanation: ondurationchange triggers when the duration of media updates.

question: The onemptied attribute specifies a script to run when media becomes ____.
explanation: onemptied triggers when media becomes empty (e.g., network error).

question: The onended attribute specifies a script to run when media reaches ____.
explanation: onended triggers when media playback completes.

question: The onloadeddata attribute specifies a script to run when media ____ is loaded.
explanation: onloadeddata triggers when the current frame of media loads.

question: The onloadedmetadata attribute specifies a script to run when media ____ is loaded.
explanation: onloadedmetadata triggers when metadata (like duration) loads.

question: The onloadstart attribute specifies a script to run when media loading ____.
explanation: onloadstart triggers when browser starts loading media.

question: The onpause attribute specifies a script to run when media is ____.
explanation: onpause triggers when media playback is paused.

question: The onplay attribute specifies a script to run when media starts ____.
explanation: onplay triggers when media starts playing.

question: The onplaying attribute specifies a script to run when media is ____ after pause.
explanation: onplaying triggers when media resumes playing after pause/buffer.

question: The onprogress attribute specifies a script to run while media is ____.
explanation: onprogress triggers periodically while media is loading.

question: The onratechange attribute specifies a script to run when playback ____ changes.
explanation: onratechange triggers when playback speed changes.

question: The onseeked attribute specifies a script to run when seeking ____.
explanation: onseeked triggers when seeking finishes and playback resumes.

question: The onseeking attribute specifies a script to run when seeking ____.
explanation: onseeking triggers when seeking starts.

question: The onstalled attribute specifies a script to run when media loading ____.
explanation: onstalled triggers when media loading is stuck.

question: The onsuspend attribute specifies a script to run when media loading is ____.
explanation: onsuspend triggers when media loading is paused (e.g., buffering).

question: The ontimeupdate attribute specifies a script to run when playback ____ changes.
explanation: ontimeupdate triggers when current playback position updates.

question: The onvolumechange attribute specifies a script to run when ____ changes.
explanation: onvolumechange triggers when audio volume changes.

question: The onwaiting attribute specifies a script to run when media ____ for more data.
explanation: onwaiting triggers when media pauses to buffer more data.

question: The onanimationend attribute specifies a script to run when CSS ____ ends.
explanation: onanimationend triggers when a CSS animation completes.

question: The onanimationiteration attribute specifies a script to run when CSS animation ____.
explanation: onanimationiteration triggers each time a CSS animation repeats.

question: The onanimationstart attribute specifies a script to run when CSS animation ____.
explanation: onanimationstart triggers when a CSS animation begins.

question: The ontransitionend attribute specifies a script to run when CSS ____ ends.
explanation: ontransitionend triggers when a CSS transition completes.

question: The ontouchcancel attribute specifies a script to run when touch event is ____.
explanation: ontouchcancel triggers when a touch event is cancelled.

question: The ontouchend attribute specifies a script to run when touch ____ ends.
explanation: ontouchend triggers when a finger is removed from screen.

question: The ontouchmove attribute specifies a script to run when touch ____ moves.
explanation: ontouchmove triggers when a finger moves across screen.

question: The ontouchstart attribute specifies a script to run when touch ____ begins.
explanation: ontouchstart triggers when a finger touches screen.

question: The oncontextmenu attribute specifies a script to run when ____ menu is triggered.
explanation: oncontextmenu triggers when user right-clicks to open context menu.

question: The onshow attribute specifies a script to run when <menu> element is ____.
explanation: onshow triggers when a context menu is displayed.

question: The ontoggle attribute specifies a script to run when <details> element is ____ or closed.
explanation: ontoggle triggers when user expands or collapses <details>.

question: The onclose attribute specifies a script to run when <dialog> element is ____.
explanation: onclose triggers when a dialog box is closed.

question: The oncancel attribute specifies a script to run when <dialog> element is ____.
explanation: oncancel triggers when user cancels a dialog (e.g., Esc key).

question: The onsort attribute specifies a script to run when user ____ a data table.

question: The onbeforeprint attribute specifies a script to run ____ document is printed.

question: The onhashchange attribute specifies a script to run when URL ____ changes.

question: The onmessage attribute specifies a script to run when ____ is received.

question: The onoffline attribute specifies a script to run when browser goes ____.

question: The ononline attribute specifies a script to run when browser goes ____.

question: The onpagehide attribute specifies a script to run when user ____ away from page.

question: The onpageshow attribute specifies a script to run when user ____ to page.

question: The onpopstate attribute specifies a script to run when window ____ changes.

question: The onstorage attribute specifies a script to run when Web ____ area updates.

question: The onundo attribute specifies a script to run when user performs ____ action.

question: The onredo attribute specifies a script to run when user performs ____ action.
explanation: onredo triggers when user redoes an action (not widely supported).

question: The onlanguagechange attribute specifies a script to run when preferred ____ change.
explanation: onlanguagechange triggers when user's preferred languages change.

question: The onorientationchange attribute specifies a script to run when device ____ changes.
explanation: onorientationchange triggers when device rotates (portrait/landscape).

question: The ondevicemotion attribute specifies a script to run when device ____ (accelerometer).
explanation: ondevicemotion triggers when device moves (acceleration data).

question: The ondeviceorientation attribute specifies a script to run when device ____ changes.
explanation: ondeviceorientation triggers when device orientation changes (gyroscope).

question: The ongamepadconnected attribute specifies a script to run when ____ is connected.

question: The ongamepaddisconnected attribute specifies a script to run when ____ is disconnected.
explanation: ongamepaddisconnected triggers when a gamepad/controller is disconnected.

question: The onvrdisplayconnect attribute specifies a script to run when VR ____ is connected.
explanation: onvrdisplayconnect triggers when a VR headset is connected.

question: The onvrdisplaydisconnect attribute specifies a script to run when VR ____ is disconnected.

question: The onvrdisplaypresentchange attribute specifies a script to run when VR ____ changes.

question: The onvrdisplayactivate attribute specifies a script to run when VR display is ____.
explanation: onvrdisplayactivate triggers when VR display is ready for presentation.

question: The onvrdisplaydeactivate attribute specifies a script to run when VR display is ____.
explanation: onvrdisplaydeactivate triggers when VR display can no longer present.

question: The onvrdisplayblur attribute specifies a script to run when VR presentation is ____.
explanation: onvrdisplayblur triggers when VR presentation loses focus.

question: The onvrdisplayfocus attribute specifies a script to run when VR presentation ____.
explanation: onvrdisplayfocus triggers when VR presentation regains focus.

question: The onpointerlockchange attribute specifies a script to run when pointer ____ changes.

question: The onpointerlockerror attribute specifies a script to run when pointer lock ____.
explanation: onpointerlockerror triggers when pointer lock request fails.

question: The onreadystatechange attribute specifies a script to run when ____ state changes.

question: The onvisibilitychange attribute specifies a script to run when page ____ changes.

question: The <circle> element in SVG draws a ____.

question: The <path> element in SVG defines a ____ to be drawn.

question: The <text> element in SVG defines ____ content.

question: The <tspan> element in SVG allows text ____ within <text>.

question: The <textPath> element in SVG renders text along a ____.

question: The <use> element in SVG ____ graphical objects.

question: The <g> element in SVG groups ____ together.

question: The <symbol> element in SVG defines reusable ____.

question: The <marker> element in SVG defines markers for lines and ____.

question: The <pattern> element in SVG defines ____ for filling or stroking.

question: The <linearGradient> element in SVG defines ____ gradients.

question: The <radialGradient> element in SVG defines ____ gradients.

question: The <stop> element in SVG defines color ____ in gradients.

question: The <clipPath> element in SVG defines ____ paths.

question: The <feBlend> element in SVG ____ two objects together.

question: The <feMorphology> element in SVG ____ or dilates input image.

question: The <feTile> element in SVG fills target rectangle with ____ pattern.

question: The <feTurbulence> element in SVG creates ____/noise texture.

question: The <animate> element in SVG animates ____ over time.

question: The <animateMotion> element in SVG animates element along a ____.

question: The <animateTransform> element in SVG animates ____ attribute.

question: The <set> element in SVG sets attribute value for specified ____.

question: WCAG stands for Web Content Accessibility ____.

question: The <embed> element is simpler alternative to <____>.

explanation: The <object> element can embed images, PDFs, Flash, or other objects.

question: The HTML ____ element defines parameters for an <object> element.
explanation: The <param> element passes parameters to embedded objects (name and value attributes).

question: The HTML ____ attribute in links to an image map.
explanation: The usemap attribute in references a element by its id (with #).

question: The HTML ____ attribute in indicates a server-side image map.
explanation: The ismap attribute makes image a server-side image map (coordinates sent to server).

question: The HTML ____ attribute in <a> suggests download rather than navigation.
explanation: The download attribute prompts user to save the linked file instead of navigating.

question: The HTML ____ attribute in <a> specifies URLs to ping when link is clicked.
explanation: The ping attribute sends POST requests to specified URLs for tracking.

question: The HTML ____ attribute in <a> specifies language of the linked document.
explanation: The hreflang attribute indicates the language of the target page.

question: The HTML ____ attribute in <link> or <a> specifies media/device capabilities.
explanation: The media attribute can target specific screen sizes, resolutions, orientations.

question: The HTML ____ attribute in <script> loads script asynchronously.
explanation: The async attribute allows script to download without blocking, executes when ready.

question: The HTML ____ attribute in <script> defers script execution.
explanation: The defer attribute delays script execution until after HTML parsing.

question: The HTML ____ attribute handles cross-origin requests for external resources.
explanation: The crossorigin attribute can be 'anonymous' or 'use-credentials' for CORS.

question: The HTML ____ attribute provides integrity checking for external resources.
explanation: The integrity attribute uses Subresource Integrity (SRI) with hash like sha256-...

question: The HTML ____ attribute controls referrer information for external resources.
explanation: The referrerpolicy can be 'no-referrer', 'origin', 'same-origin', etc.

question: The HTML ____ element defines a template for client-side content.
explanation: The <template> element holds HTML that can be cloned and inserted via JavaScript.

question: The HTML ____ element defines a slot in a web component.
explanation: The <slot> element creates a placeholder in shadow DOM for user-provided content.

question: The HTML ____ element defines a dialog box or window.
explanation: The <dialog> element creates modal or non-modal dialog with showModal() method.

question: The HTML ____ element defines details disclosure widget.
explanation: The <details> element creates expandable/collapsible section with <summary>.

question: The HTML ____ element defines summary for <details> element.
explanation: The <summary> element provides clickable heading for <details> content.

question: The HTML ____ element defines a data list for autocomplete suggestions.
explanation: The <datalist> contains <option> elements suggested for <input list='id'>.

question: The HTML ____ element defines output of a calculation.
explanation: The <output> element displays result of calculation, typically from form inputs.

question: The HTML ____ element defines scalar measurement within known range.
explanation: The <meter> element shows value like disk usage, voting results within min/max.

question: The HTML ____ element shows progress of a task.
explanation: The <progress> element displays completion percentage of a task like file upload.

question: The HTML ____ element defines a ruby annotation for East Asian typography.
explanation: The <ruby> element contains <rt> for pronunciation and optionally <rp> for parentheses.

question: The HTML ____ element defines ruby text annotation.
explanation: The <rt> element provides pronunciation, translation, or annotation for ruby base.

question: The HTML ____ element defines ruby parentheses for fallback.
explanation: The <rp> element provides parentheses around <rt> for browsers without ruby support.

question: The HTML ____ element isolates bidirectional text from surrounding text.
explanation: The <bdi> element isolates span of text that might have different directionality.

question: The HTML ____ element overrides current text direction.
explanation: The <bdo> element with dir='rtl' forces right-to-left text regardless of context.

question: The HTML ____ element represents word break opportunity.
explanation: The <wbr> element suggests where word could be broken if line wrapping needed.

question: The HTML ____ element defines a variable in programming or mathematics.
explanation: The <var> element represents a variable name in code or mathematical expression.

question: The HTML ____ element defines sample output from computer program.
explanation: The <samp> element represents sample output from a program or system.

question: The HTML ____ element defines keyboard input.
explanation: The <kbd> element represents user keyboard input, like keyboard shortcuts.

question: The HTML ____ element defines preformatted text preserving whitespace.
explanation: The <pre> element displays text exactly as written, preserving spaces and line breaks.

question: The HTML ____ element defines a short inline quotation.
explanation: The <q> element marks up short quotations that don't require paragraph breaks.

question: The HTML ____ element defines a block-level quotation.
explanation: The <blockquote> element marks up extended quotations, often with cite attribute.

question: The HTML ____ element defines an abbreviation or acronym.
explanation: The <abbr> element marks up abbreviations with optional title attribute for expansion.

question: The HTML ____ element defines contact information for author/owner.
explanation: The <address> element provides contact information for nearest <article> or <body>.

question: The HTML ____ element defines the title of a creative work.
explanation: The <cite> element marks up titles of books, films, music, etc.

question: The HTML ____ element represents defining instance of a term.
explanation: The <dfn> element marks the term being defined, often with <abbr> or <cite> inside.

question: The HTML ____ element marks text that has been inserted into document.
explanation: The <ins> element represents content added to document, often with cite and datetime.

question: The HTML ____ element marks text that has been deleted from document.
explanation: The <del> element represents content removed from document, often with cite and datetime.

question: The HTML ____ element marks text no longer accurate/relevant.
explanation: The <s> element represents content no longer correct or relevant (strikethrough).

question: The HTML ____ element marks text with stylistic difference.
explanation: The <u> element underlines text for stylistic purposes like proper names in Chinese.

question: The HTML ____ element marks text with strong importance.
explanation: The <strong> element indicates strong importance, seriousness, or urgency.

question: The HTML ____ element marks text with stress emphasis.
explanation: The <em> element marks text with stressed emphasis, typically italicized.

question: The HTML ____ element marks text with offset typographically.
explanation: The <i> element marks text in alternate voice or mood, technical terms, thoughts.

question: The HTML ____ element marks text stylistically bold without importance.
explanation: The <b> element draws attention without conveying extra importance, like keywords.

question: The HTML ____ element marks highlighted text for reference.
explanation: The <mark> element highlights text for reference or notation purposes.

question: The HTML ____ element marks smaller text (fine print).
explanation: The <small> element represents side comments, fine print, copyright, legal text.

question: The HTML ____ element marks subscript text.
explanation: The <sub> element renders text as subscript (lower and smaller).

question: The HTML ____ element marks superscript text.
explanation: The <sup> element renders text as superscript (higher and smaller).

question: The HTML ____ attribute defines unique identifier for element.
explanation: The id attribute gives element unique name for CSS, JavaScript, anchors.

question: The HTML ____ attribute defines one or more class names for element.
explanation: The class attribute groups elements for CSS styling and JavaScript selection.

question: The HTML ____ attribute defines inline CSS styles for element.
explanation: The style attribute contains CSS declarations applied directly to element.

question: The HTML ____ attribute defines advisory title for element.
explanation: The title attribute provides extra information shown as tooltip on hover.

question: The HTML ____ attribute defines language of element content.
explanation: The lang attribute specifies language of element content (e.g., 'en', 'fr').

question: The HTML ____ attribute defines text direction of element content.
explanation: The dir attribute can be 'ltr' (left-to-right), 'rtl' (right-to-left), or 'auto'.

question: The HTML ____ attribute makes element content editable by user.
explanation: The contenteditable attribute turns element into rich text editor.

question: The HTML ____ attribute hides element from display.
explanation: The hidden attribute indicates element is not yet or no longer relevant.

question: The HTML ____ attribute makes element draggable.
explanation: The draggable attribute enables drag-and-drop API interaction.

question: The HTML ____ attribute enables spell checking for editable elements.
explanation: The spellcheck attribute can be 'true' or 'false' for contenteditable or inputs.

question: The HTML ____ attribute provides keyboard shortcut for element.
explanation: The accesskey attribute defines keyboard shortcut to activate/focus element.

question: The HTML ____ attribute controls text autocapitalization on mobile.
explanation: The autocapitalize attribute can be 'none', 'sentences', 'words', 'characters'.

question: The HTML ____ attribute hints virtual keyboard configuration.
explanation: The inputmode attribute suggests keyboard type: 'none', 'text', 'decimal', etc.

question: The HTML ____ attribute creates customized built-in element.
explanation: The is attribute extends native HTML elements with custom behavior.

question: The HTML ____ attribute defines microdata item scope.
explanation: The itemscope attribute creates new microdata item (part of structured data).

question: The HTML ____ attribute specifies microdata vocabulary URL.
explanation: The itemtype attribute points to vocabulary URL like http://schema.org/Person.

question: The HTML ____ attribute defines microdata property.
explanation: The itemprop attribute names property of microdata item.

question: The HTML ____ attribute stores custom data private to page.
explanation: Data-* attributes (data-user, data-id) store custom data accessible via JavaScript.

question: The HTML ____ attribute defines ARIA role for accessibility.
explanation: The role attribute defines semantic role for assistive technologies.

question: The HTML ____ attribute provides accessible name for element.
explanation: The aria-label attribute gives text label for screen readers when visible label absent.

question: The HTML ____ attribute references elements that label current element.
explanation: The aria-labelledby attribute points to element(s) that serve as label.

question: The HTML ____ attribute references elements that describe current element.
explanation: The aria-describedby attribute points to element(s) that provide description.

question: The HTML ____ attribute hides element from accessibility APIs.
explanation: The aria-hidden='true' removes element from accessibility tree.

question: The HTML ____ attribute indicates live region for dynamic content.
explanation: The aria-live attribute can be 'polite', 'assertive', or 'off' for announcements.

question: The HTML ____ attribute indicates entire region should be announced.
explanation: The aria-atomic='true' makes screen reader announce entire region not just changes.

question: The HTML ____ attribute indicates element is being updated.
explanation: The aria-busy='true' tells assistive tech that element content is changing.

question: The HTML ____ attribute identifies elements controlled by current element.
explanation: The aria-controls attribute points to element(s) that this element controls.

question: The HTML ____ attribute indicates current item within set.
explanation: The aria-current can be 'page', 'step', 'location', 'date', 'time', or 'true'.

question: The HTML ____ attribute indicates element is perceivable but disabled.
explanation: The aria-disabled='true' indicates element exists but can't be interacted with.

question: The HTML ____ attribute indicates expandable element state.
explanation: The aria-expanded indicates whether controlled content is expanded ('true'/'false').

question: The HTML ____ attribute indicates element has popup.
explanation: The aria-haspopup can be 'true', 'menu', 'listbox', 'tree', 'grid', or 'dialog'.

question: The HTML ____ attribute indicates entered value doesn't conform.
explanation: The aria-invalid can be 'true', 'false', 'grammar', 'spelling', or value description.

question: The HTML ____ attribute defines hierarchical level within structure.
explanation: The aria-level defines level in heading hierarchy or tree structure (1, 2, 3...).

question: The HTML ____ attribute indicates whether element is modal.
explanation: The aria-modal='true' indicates dialog blocks interaction with other content.

question: The HTML ____ attribute indicates textbox accepts multiple lines.
explanation: The aria-multiline='true' indicates textbox is multi-line like textarea.

question: The HTML ____ attribute indicates multiple items can be selected.
explanation: The aria-multiselectable='true' indicates list allows multiple selection.

question: The HTML ____ attribute indicates element orientation.
explanation: The aria-orientation can be 'horizontal', 'vertical', or undefined.

question: The HTML ____ attribute defines placeholder text.
explanation: The aria-placeholder provides hint text for input when empty.

question: The HTML ____ attribute indicates toggle button state.
explanation: The aria-pressed can be 'true', 'false', or 'mixed' for toggle buttons.

question: The HTML ____ attribute indicates element is not editable.
explanation: The aria-readonly='true' indicates content can be read but not modified.

question: The HTML ____ attribute indicates user input is required.
explanation: The aria-required='true' indicates field must be filled out before submission.

question: The HTML ____ attribute indicates current selected state.
explanation: The aria-selected indicates whether option is selected ('true'/'false').

question: The HTML ____ attribute indicates sort order of items.
